intro: Artemisia scoparia, commonly known as wormwood, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family. It is characterized by its gray-green, aromatic foliage and small yellow flowers that appear in late summer. Native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, it thrives in dry, well-drained soils. The plant is known for its strong, pungent odor and has been used historically in herbal medicine. It is also a common weed in agricultural fields and disturbed areas.
